title: Space Race Events Quiz
description: How well do you recall the thrilling milestones of the Space Race?

questions.question: In what year did the Soviet Union launch Sputnik, the first artificial satellite?
questions.explanation: The Soviet Union launched Sputnik 1 on October 4, 1957, marking the beginning of the Space Age and the Space Race.

questions.question: Who was the first human to orbit the Earth?
questions.explanation: Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin became the first human in space on April 12, 1961, orbiting Earth aboard Vostok 1.

questions.question: Who was the first American to orbit the Earth?
questions.explanation: John Glenn orbited the Earth three times on February 20, 1962, aboard Friendship 7, becoming a national hero.

questions.question: On what date did Neil Armstrong first walk on the Moon?
questions.explanation: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin landed on the Moon on July 20, 1969, during the Apollo 11 mission.

questions.question: What was the name of the first animal sent into orbit by the Soviet Union?
questions.explanation: Laika, a stray dog from Moscow, was sent into orbit aboard Sputnik 2 on November 3, 1957, becoming the first animal to orbit Earth.

questions.question: Which Apollo mission experienced a near-disaster and was called a 'successful failure'?
questions.explanation: Apollo 13 suffered an oxygen tank explosion in April 1970, but the crew safely returned to Earth in one of NASA's finest hours.

questions.question: Who was the first American in space (suborbital flight)?
questions.explanation: Alan Shepard became the first American in space on May 5, 1961, making a 15-minute suborbital flight aboard Freedom 7.

questions.question: Which president delivered the famous speech committing America to landing on the Moon?
questions.explanation: President John F. Kennedy delivered his famous Moon speech to Congress on May 25, 1961, pledging to land a man on the Moon by the end of the decade.

questions.question: What was the first manned Apollo mission to orbit the Moon?
questions.explanation: Apollo 8, crewed by Frank Borman, Jim Lovell, and William Anders, became the first manned spacecraft to orbit the Moon in December 1968.

questions.question: Who was the second person to walk on the Moon?
questions.explanation: Buzz Aldrin was the second person to walk on the Moon, following Neil Armstrong during the Apollo 11 mission on July 20, 1969.

questions.question: Which Soviet cosmonaut performed the first spacewalk?
questions.explanation: Alexei Leonov performed the first extravehicular activity (spacewalk) on March 18, 1965, floating outside the Voskhod 2 spacecraft for 12 minutes.

questions.question: What was the name of the joint US-Soviet space mission in 1975?
questions.explanation: The Apollo-Soyuz Test Project in July 1975 was the first joint US-Soviet space mission, symbolizing a thaw in Cold War tensions.

questions.question: Which was the last Apollo mission to land on the Moon?
questions.explanation: Apollo 17 in December 1972 was the last manned Moon landing mission, with Eugene Cernan being the last person to walk on the Moon.

questions.question: What tragic event killed three astronauts during a launch pad test in January 1967?
questions.explanation: The Apollo 1 fire on January 27, 1967, killed astronauts Gus Grissom, Ed White, and Roger Chaffee during a pre-launch test.

questions.question: What was America's first space station, launched in 1973?
questions.explanation: Skylab was the United States' first space station, launched on May 14, 1973, and hosted three crews of astronauts before being abandoned in 1974.
